statement.tex:
\text{Find the values of x, y, z and w, if }\\ 3 \left[\begin{array}{cc} x & y \\ z & w \end{array} \right] =
\left[\begin{array}{cc} x & 6 \\ -1 & 2w \end{array} \right] + \left[\begin{array}{cc} 4 & x+y \\ z+w & 3 \end{array} \right]

step.tex: (i) \,\text{A and B have the same order.}\\ (ii) \,\text{$A+B$ and $A-B $ are defined and the}\\ \text{resultant matrices have order }m \times n.\\
(i) \,\text{A and B have the same order.}\\ (ii) \,\text{$A+B$ and $A-B $ are defined and the}\\ \text{resultant matrices have order }1\times 1.
step.reason: \text{Only matrices having the {\bf same order} i.e.}\\ \text{equal no. of rows (m) and equal no. of}\\ \text{columns (n) can be added and the order}\\ \text{of the resultant matrix is also m \times n.}

step.context:
\text{Are the following calculations and conclusion}\\ \text{correct? Given,}\\ 3 \left[\begin{array}{cc} x & y \\ z & w \end{array} \right] =
\left[\begin{array}{cc} x & 6 \\ -1 & 2w \end{array} \right] + \left[\begin{array}{cc} 4 & x+y \\ z+w & 3 \end{array} \right]
step.tex:
\begin{align} 3 \left[\begin{array}{cc} x & y \\ z & w \end{array} \right] &= \left[\begin{array}{cc} 3 x & 3 y \\ 3 z & 3w \end{array} \right] \\
\text{Also, }\left[\begin{array}{cc} x & 6 \\ -1 & 2w \end{array} \right] &+ \left[\begin{array}{cc} 4 & x+y \\ z+w & 3 \end{array} \right] \\
&=
\left[\begin{array}{cc} x +4 & 6 +x+y\\ -1+z+w & 2w+3 \end{array} \right] \\
\implies \left[\begin{array}{cc} 3 x & 3 y \\ 3 z & 3w \end{array} \right] &= \left[\begin{array}{cc} x +4 & 6 +x+y\\ -1+z+w & 2w+3 \end{array} \right] \end{align}\\
\begin{align}
\implies 3x &= x+4 \\ 3y &= 6+x+y\\ 3z &=-1+z+w\\ 3w &= 2w+3 \end{align}\\
\qquad \therefore x=2, y=4, w=3, z=1

choices.tex: x=2, y=4, \text{not possible to find w and z.}
